title.rendered: Aer Lingus Airlines Offers Dublin, London and Paris for 7, 8 or 9 Nights

content.rendered:
Aer Lingus

Aer Lingus (Airlines) was established in 15 April 1936, commenced operations in 27 May 1936. Aer Lingus is the flag carrier airline of Ireland and the second-largest airline in Ireland. Founded by the Irish government, it was privatised between 2006 and 2015 and it is now a subsidiary of International Airlines Group (IAG), the parent company of British Airways, Iberia and Vueling.

Aer Lingus Airlines Offers

Explore Dublin, London and Paris for 7, 8 or 9 nights.

Includes

  • Round-trip airfare to Dublin (DUB) and from Paris (CDG)
  • One-way economy class airfare from Dublin to London
  • Rail ticket from London to Paris

Itinerary & Places to Visit

  • 2 nights in Dublin at the North Star Hotel or similar, without breakfast
  • 2 nights in London at the Clayton Crown Hotel , breakfast included
  • 3 nights in Paris at Hotel ibis Paris Bastille Faubourg Saint Antoine 11th or similar, breakfast included

For more details dial 800-495-1632.

View deal here
